content: Please use the already existing https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1505142 instead of creating new questions.
creator: wsmwk

content: Never mind, as usually happens within half an hour of asking for help, I found the answer. My ISP has had an expired site certificate for a couple of years now, I used to be able to store it permanently. Thunderbird decided at some point that permanently actually means every other day or so but would create an annoying popup to tell you that. A few releases ago, the annoying popup got replace by a silly little window that only stays active for a few seconds and if you don't see it and click on it, you had to restart Thunderbird until you were quick enough to hit it. I guess this "feature" is gone completely and I now have to add it manually in the Manage Certificates section that took me a quarter hour to even find. Thanks, Mozilla for making life increasingly stupid and wasting hours and hours of users' time and sanity.
creator: cable198

content: Alternatively, if there's a way to have Thunderbird delete/remove all outbound .html attachments that would also solve the problem.

content: collected addresses are in history.sqlite. Use the same tools>import>import from a file>addressbook menus to do that.
creator: davidsk

content: To use Thunderbird to its strengths, I encourage you to focus on that instead of wanting Thunderbird to be like Outlook. It's different, some things better, and maybe some not. Filters are the 'rules' in Thunderbird and they can do a lot. Welcome to Thunderbird. Where you have specific questions, we will attempt to assist.
creator: davidsk

content: There may be a problem with your SMTP settings. Please post a screenshot of the SMTP server settings pane and the full error message in English. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Without seeing the message, my inference is that your email provider wants you to put whatever authentication they prefer in your SMTP server settings. I suggest checking the SMTP server setting requirements for myhighspeed.ca
creator: davidsk

content: Reinstalling is rarely a solution. Instead of attempting to untick vertical view, tick classic view Manually close the tabs across screen and I suggest reviewing settings>general and then 'Window Layout' to adjust tab settings.
creator: davidsk

content: If that happens, it is because the email provider is doing this. Check your online accounts for possible forwarding from one account to another.
creator: davidsk
